surfaces

Class Point3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • surfaces.Point3D
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WPoint3D

    public class Point3D
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates 3D coordinate objects which are used as vertices in the models

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point3D(double x, double y, double z)
      Instantiator which creates a new 3D point.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D clone()
      Produces a new point with the same coordinates as the current point.
      double[] coordinates()
      Returns the coordinates of the point.
      double dist(Point3D p)
      Calculates the distance between the current point and the given point.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Checks if two points are equal to each other with a difference of maximally 10E-14.
      double getX()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the point.
      double getY()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the point.
      double getZ()
      Returns the z-coordinate of the point.
      void setX(double x)
      Sets the current x-coordinate to the new given x-coordinate.
      void setY(double y)
      Sets the current y-coordinate to the new given y-coordinate.
      void setZ(double z)
      Sets the current z-coordinate to the new given z-coordinate.
      Point3D subtract(double x, double y, double z)
      Subtracts the given coordinates from the current coordinates.
      Point3D subtract(Point3D point)
      Uses another points coordinates to subtract these from the current coordinates.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the coordinates in a String form.
